intro: Heliotropium maculatum, commonly known as the spotted heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a white or yellow center. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or along roadsides. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Heliotropium maculatum is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
